caption:
The International Red Cross transfers hostages in Gaza as onlookers cheer on the first day of the war’s first truce, November 24, 2023.
 
Hamas fighters released 24 hostages, including Israeli women and children and Thai farm workers, after guns fell silent across the Gaza Strip for the first time in seven weeks.
 
🔗 Read more at our link in bio

"A universal wrong:" Britain dominated the development of slavery in North America and the Caribbean. A deep Reuters analysis found some wealthy investors in this trade are the direct ancestors of King Charles III, finance minister Jeremy Hunt and three other sitting government ministers including David Cameron.
 
This story is the latest in a Reuters series examining slavery and the political elite. 🔗 Read more at the link in our bio.

Israeli soldiers smile atop a military vehicle after leaving Gaza during the temporary truce between the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas and Israel on November 24, 2023. 
 
Combat between Israeli troops and Hamas fighters halted on Friday for the first time in seven weeks in a temporary truce ahead of the planned release of Israeli hostages held by the militants in exchange for jailed Palestinians.
 
No big bombings, artillery strikes or rocket attacks were reported, although Hamas and Israel both accused each other of sporadic shootings and other violations. Both said the war would resume on full throttle as soon as the truce was over. 🔗 Read the latest news at our link in bio 📷 Amir Cohen #israel #gaza #reuters #reutersphotos #war #conflict

Americans celebrate Thanksgiving on November 23, 2023, with heightened security measures in place as tensions run high over the conflict between Israel and Hamas in Gaza. Extra precautions are being taken at airports and shopping malls across the United States and along the route of New York's signature Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. 
 
🎈 This year's parade features demonstrators, Santa Claus, and many balloons. 🔗 See highlights from the 97th Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade at our link in bio 📷 Brendan Mcdermid and Mike Segar

A vehicle exploded on the Rainbow Bridge linking Canada with the United States at Niagara Falls, prompting authorities to close that border crossing and the three others between western New York and southern Ontario, officials said.
 
The FBI Joint Terrorism Task Force was mobilized to investigate the incident, according to New York Governor Kathy Hochul. Two people in the vehicle were killed in the explosion and one border patrol official was injured, according to several media reports that cited unnamed law enforcement sources.
 
Initial indications from the U.S. Customs and Border Protection agency were that incident was caused by a reckless driver whose actions resulted in a crash and fire, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.
 
A preliminary investigation has found no indication of a terrorist attack in an explosion on the Rainbow Bridge linking Canada with the US at Niagara Falls, New York Governor Kathy Hochul said.
 
🔗 Read more at our link in bio.
 
#Reuters #videonews #topstories #topnews #NewYork #Niagara #USCanada #USCanadaborder #borderexplosion #KathyHochul

An account of life in wartime from Gaza, based on reporting by Reuters journalists at the Nasser Hospital and the daily observations of the team in Khan Younis. Stories of new parents, refugees, and a morgue director paint the picture of life and death in Gaza amid the Israel-Hamas war. 🔗 Read more at our link in bio

#Israel #Gaza #Hamas #Israelis #Palestinians #MiddleEast #News #Photography

A woman walks in a snow covered park in Kyiv, Ukraine, November 22, 2023. 
Snow and freezing temperatures are expected to drop lower, further complicating operations on the battleground, where fighting is moving to an attritional phase.  
Ukrainian troops face "difficult" defensive operations on parts of the eastern front with bitter winter cold setting in, but forces in the south are still conducting offensive actions, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.  
🔗 Read more at the link in bio 📷 Valentyn Ogirenko #ukraine #winter #snow #weather #reuters #reutersphotos

Elon Musk has said Tesla Insurance offers “vastly better” service than other auto insurers. But scores of customers have said they can’t reach claims adjusters or have waited weeks or months for repairs or compensation. 🔗 Read more at our link in bio.

A dog swims in front of a man paddling due to flooding caused by heavy rains in Ilha Grande dos Marinheiros in Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul state, Brazil, November 20, 2023. 📷 Diego Vara #floods #Brazil #weather #environment #reuters #reutersphotos

Hindu devotees worship the Sun god as they stand in foam covering the polluted Yamuna river during the Hindu religious festival of Chhath Puja on a smoggy morning in New Delhi, India, November 20, 2023. 📷 @anushree_fadnavis #delhi #india #reuters #reutersphotos #pollution

A group of 28 premature babies evacuated from Gaza’s biggest hospital were taken into Egypt for urgent treatment. The newborns had been in north Gaza’s Al Shifa hospital, where several others died after their incubators were knocked out amid a collapse of medical services during Israel’s military assault on Gaza City.
 
Israeli forces seized Shifa last week to search for what they said was a Hamas tunnel network built underneath. Hundreds of patients, medical staff and displaced people left Shifa over the weekend, with doctors saying they were ejected by troops and Israel saying the departures were voluntary.
 
All of the evacuated babies were “fighting serious infections,” a WHO spokesperson said. Eight infants have died since doctors at Shifa originally raised an international alarm this month of about 39 premature babies at risk from a lack of infection control, clean water and medicines in the neo-natal ward.
 
🔗 Read more about the Israel-Hamas war at our link in bio.
 
#Reuters #video #videonews #topstories #topnews #Israel #Israelis #Hamas #Palestinians #Palestinianterritories #Palestinian #Hamasattack #conflict #Gaza #IsraelHamas #IsraelHamaswar #IsraelHamasconflict #prematurebabies #Egypt #egyptgazaborder

Argentine presidential candidate Javier Milei visits a polling station to cast his vote in Buenos Aires, November 19, 2023, during Argentina's runoff presidential election. 
 
The libertarian president-elect won a closely fought election. Now comes the hard part: dealing with economic crises.
 
Inflation is at 143%, net reserves of foreign currency are deep in the red, savers are ditching the peso, and a recession is looming, if not already here. Four in 10 Argentines live in poverty and a sharp peso devaluation is likely.
 
Milei, who is pledging economic "shock therapy" such as dollarization and shutting the central bank, won a second-round runoff vote on Sunday with some 56% to rival Sergio Massa's 44%. 
 
🔗 Read the latest on the election at our link in bio. 📷 @AgustinMarcarian #Argentina #reuters #reutersphotos #Milei

A Palestinian man sits with a child wounded in an Israeli strike at Nasser hospital in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, November 18, 2023.

Hamas gunmen battled Israeli forces trying to push into Gaza's largest refugee camp on Sunday, while U.S. and Israeli officials said a deal to free some Israeli hostages was edging closer. 
Israel also is preparing to expand its offensive against Hamas to Gaza's southern half, signaled by increasing air strikes. 

The United States cautioned Israel not to embark on combat operations in the south until military planners have taken into account the safety of fleeing Palestinian civilians. 

Gaza's traumatized population has been sheltering in hospitals or trudging from the north to the south and, in some cases, back again, to try to avoid being killed. 

Gaza's Hamas-run government said at least 13,000 Palestinians have died in Israeli bombardments since Israel’s assault began, including at least 5,500 children. 

🔗 Read the latest on the Israel-Hamas war at our link in bio. 📷 @MohammedSalem85 #Gaza #reuters #reutersphotos #Israel #war #conflict

SpaceX's next-generation Starship spacecraft, atop its powerful Super Heavy rocket, is launched from the company's Boca Chica launchpad on an uncrewed test flight near Brownsville, Texas, November 18, 2023. 📷 @joeskipper #reuters #reutersphotos #texas #spacex #starship

Members of the Israeli military grieve during the funeral of Israeli soldier Avraham Fetena, who died from wounds sustained during Israel's ongoing ground operation in Gaza, in Haifa, Israel, November 17, 2023. Israel's military, which has concentrated its assault on northern Gaza, said its troops and war planes were keeping up pressure on Friday.
 
Overnight they took control of an Islamic Jihad commander's stronghold, it said, and also killed Hamas fighters inside a school where they found a large number of weapons. The conflict was triggered by a cross-border raid by Hamas militants on Oct. 7 that killed about 1,200 Israelis, mostly civilians, in the deadliest day in the state's 75-year-history.
 
More than 11,500 Palestinians, at least 4,700 of them children, have now been killed in Israel's retaliatory military assault on Hamas-ruled Gaza, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry - a toll that far surpasses previous bouts of conflict in recent years. 
 
🔗 Read the latest on the Israel-Hamas war at our link in bio. 📷 Shir Torem  #Israel #reuters #reutersphotos #Gaza #war

Police in riot gear used pepper spray and made arrests to try to disperse demonstrators who had gathered outside the Democratic National Committee headquarters on November 15 to demand a ceasefire in Gaza.
 
 
The demonstration was organized by three advocacy groups and took place in an area near the U.S. Capitol building.
 
🔗 Read more at our link in bio.

Northern Lights, also called Aurora Borealis, illuminate the night sky as cars park near Mo i Rana, Norway, November 15, 2023. 📷 @Lisi_Niesner #northernlights #nature #environment #norway #reuters #reutersphotos

📷 @alina_smutko recently photographed a shelter for internally displaced people (IDPs) in Kostiantynivka, Ukraine, a city in the Donetsk region about four miles from the front line. Families with children usually stay for a few days, while older evacuees are harder to find permanent homes for and sometimes stay for months. 🔗 Read more at our link in bio.

U.S. Senator Markwayne Mullin rose from his seat and challenged Teamsters union president Sean O’Brien to a fight, before committee chair Bernie Sanders stepped in defuse the confrontation. The verbal sparring began after Mullin, an Oklahoma Republican, paraphrased from a June tweet posted by O’Brien about the senator: “What a clown, a fraud. Always has been, always will be. Quit the tough guy act in these Senate hearings. You know where to find me. Any place, anytime cowboy.”
 
Mullin finished with an offer to fight O’Brien at the hearing. “Sir, this is a time, this is a place, if you want to run your mouth, we can be two consenting adults, we can finish it here,” he said, while pointing to the floor separating the two.
 
O’Brien responded, “OK that’s fine, perfect ... You stand your butt up, big guy.” Mullin then rose from his seat and moved to remove his wedding ring.
 
At that point Senator Sanders said to Mullin: “You’re a United States senator, sit down.”
 
🔗 Read more at our link in bio.
 
#Reuters #videonews #topstories #topnews #TeamstersUnion #SenatorMarkwayneMullin #Congress #CapitolHill #BernieSanders

🐠 A vast treasure of critical minerals lies on the ocean floor. Should they be extracted to help fight climate change? 
 
🌊 The International Seabed Authority is working to set regulations for deep-sea mining as companies engaged in the clean energy transition clamor for more minerals. 
 
🔗 Read more from Reuters Graphics at our link in bio

⚡️🚁 Electric aircraft maker Joby Aviation achieved a milestone with its exhibition flight at the Downtown Manhattan Heliport in New York City, marking the city’s first-ever electric air taxi flight. It plans to launch commercial flights in 2025.
 
#Reuters #videonews #NewYork #NewYorkCity #NYC #JobyAviation #electrichelicopter #airtaxi #electricairtaxi

Tens of thousands of demonstrators gathered in Washington, D.C., on November 14, 2023, for a "March for Israel" to show solidarity with Israel in its war with Hamas and condemn rising antisemitism.
 
Streets were closed around much of downtown amid heightened security, as people gathered on the National Mall, many draped in Israeli and U.S. flags.
 
People in the crowd held up signs showing the names and photographs of people kidnapped by Hamas, and chanted "bring them home." Other signs included “We have no where else to go” and “civilians who praise the slaughter of Jews are not innocent.”
 
🔗 Read the latest on the Israel-Hamas war at our link in bio. 📷 @LeahMillis #Israel #rally #reuters #reutersphotos #DC #gaza

Medical staff sewed up a patient’s head wound using a flashlight from a mobile phone amid power cuts at north Gaza’s Indonesia hospital. Israeli tanks took up positions at the gates of Gaza City’s main hospital, the primary target in their battle to seize control of the northern half of the Gaza Strip, where medics said patients including newborns were dying for lack of fuel.
 
Gaza health ministry spokesperson Ashraf Al-Qidra, who was inside Al Shifa hospital, said 32 patients had died in the past three days, including three newborn babies, as a result of the siege of the hospital and lack of power.
 
At least 650 patients were still inside, desperate to be evacuated to another medical facility by the Red Cross or some other neutral agency. Israel says the hospital sits atop tunnels housing a headquarters for Hamas fighters using patients as shields, which Hamas denies.
 
Israel launched its campaign last month to annihilate Hamas, the militant group which runs the Gaza Strip, after Hamas fighters rampaged through southern Israel killing civilians. Around 1,200 people died and 240 were dragged to Gaza as hostages, according to Israel’s tally, in the deadliest day in its 75-year history.
 
🔗 Read more about the Israel-Hamas war at our link in bio.
 
#Reuters #video #videonews #topstories #topnews #Israel #Israelis #Hamas #Palestinians #Palestinianterritories #Palestinian #Hamasattack #conflict #Gaza #IsraelHamas #IsraelHamaswar #IsraelHamasconflict

Newborns are placed in a bed after being taken off incubators at Gaza's Al Shifa hospital after a power outage in Gaza City, November 12, 2023.
 
Two more major hospitals in Gaza closed to new patients on Sunday, with staff saying that Israeli bombardment plus lack of fuel and medicine meant more could die.
 
Hospitals in the north of the Palestinian enclave are blockaded by Israeli forces and barely able to care for those inside, medical staff said. Israel says it is homing in on Hamas militants in the area and the hospitals should be evacuated.
 
Gaza's largest and second-largest hospitals, Al Shifa and Al-Quds, said they were suspending operations. With more people killed and wounded daily but half of the territory's hospitals now out of action, there are ever fewer places for the injured.
 
🔗 Read the latest on the Israel-Hamas war at our link in bio. 📷 Photo obtained by Reuters #gaza #hospital #babies #israel #war #conflict

Palestinians flee north Gaza to move southward as Israeli tanks roll deeper into the enclave in the central Gaza Strip, November 12, 2023. 🔗 Read the latest on the Israel-Hamas war at our link in bio. 📷 @Ibraheem_Abu_Mustafa
#Israel #Gaza #reuters #reutersphotos

The United States Air Force's B-21 "Raider," a long-range stealth bomber that can be armed with nuclear weapons, takes off on its first flight from the runway at Northrop Grumman's site at Air Force Plant 42, in Palmdale, California, November 10, 2023. 📷 @photoswanson #reuters #reutersphotos #airforce #b21

Israeli air strikes devastated parts of the Jabalia refugee camp in north Gaza, flattening buildings in a densely populated area where at least 195 civilians were killed and scores more are still missing, Palestinian authorities say.
The strikes at the Jabalia camp – the largest of several refugee settlements in Gaza – have fueled international concern at the mounting humanitarian toll of Israel’s campaign.
🔗 Read more at our link in bio.

Israeli troops maneuver near the Israel-Gaza border, as seen from southern Israel, November 9, 2023. 

Israel has agreed to pause military operations in parts of north Gaza for four hours a day from Thursday, the White House said, raising hopes of a respite in more than a month of fighting that has killed thousands and stoked fears of regional conflict.

The pauses, that would allow people to flee along two humanitarian corridors and could be used for the release of hostages, were significant first steps, White House national security spokesperson John Kirby said. 

🔗 Read the latest on the war at our link in bio. 📷 @Evelynpix #Israel #Gaza #reuters #reutersphotos #war #conflict

A man attempts to rescue a boy from raging flood waters following heavy rains in Mogadishu, Somalia, November 9, 2023. 
 
The worst flooding to hit Somalia in decades has killed 29 people and forced more than 300,000 to flee their homes, the National Disaster Management Agency said.
 
Authorities have scrambled to rescue thousands of stranded people from the floodwater, which comes on the heels of the region's worst drought in 40 years. 🔗 Read more at our link in bio 📷 @Feisal.o #flooding #disaster #weather #environment #reuters #reutersphotos

Giant pandas Mei Xiang, Tian Tian and Xiao Qi depart Washington D.C.’s National Zoo to return to China.
 
Mei Xiang and Tian Tian came to the zoo in 2000 under a cooperative research and breeding agreement with the China Wildlife Conservation Association. The pandas were initially meant to stay 10 years, but the agreement has been renewed three times since 2010.
 
The zoo’s giant panda program began in 1972, when Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai donated two pandas to the United States soon after President Richard Nixon’s historic visit to China that year.
 
#Panda #GiantPandas #MeiXiang #TianTian #XiaoQiJi #WashingtonZoo #SmithsonianNationalZoo #Reuters #News #Animals

Emad El Salot's son mourns his father who was killed in Israeli strikes in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, November 8, 2023. Air strikes on the Gaza Strip killed a Hamas weapons maker and several fighters, the Israeli military said on Wednesday, as its air and ground offensive targeted the militants' tunnel network beneath the besieged Palestinian enclave.
 
Gaza City, the Hamas militant group's main stronghold in the territory, is encircled by Israeli forces. The Israeli military said troops have advanced to the heart of the densely populated city while Hamas says its fighters have inflicted heavy losses. With the war now entering its second month, UN officials and G7 nations stepped up appeals for a humanitarian pause in the hostilities to help alleviate the suffering in Gaza, where buildings have been flattened and basic supplies are running out. Palestinian officials say more than 10,000 people have been killed, 40% of them children. 
 
🔗 Read the latest on the war at our link in bio. 📷 @MohammedSalem85 #Gaza #reuters #reutersphotos #Israel #war #conflict

A moment of silence takes place across Israel and beyond on November 7, 2023, to commemorate the victims of the October 7 Hamas attacks while hostages are still held in Gaza.
 
Israel said on Tuesday its forces were operating deep in Gaza City in their battle to wipe out Hamas in the Palestinian enclave, and that the Islamist militant group’s leader was trapped inside a bunker. 🔗 Read the latest on the war at our link in bio

Britain's King Charles and Queen Camilla pass protesters as they travel by carriage to the State Opening of Parliament, in London, November 7, 2023. 📷 Hollie Adams #london #kingcharles #king #monarchy #royal #royalty #reuters #reutersphotos

Palestinians evacuate the site of Israeli strikes on houses in Maghazi refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip, November 6, 2023. 

Gaza is becoming a "graveyard for children," U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres said on Monday, amplifying demands for a ceasefire in the enclave, where Palestinian health authorities said the death toll from Israeli strikes had exceeded 10,000.

Both Israel and the Hamas militants who control Gaza have rebuffed mounting international pressure for a ceasefire. Israel says hostages taken by Hamas during its rampage in southern Israel on Oct. 7 should be released first; Hamas says it will not free them or stop fighting while Gaza is under assault. 

🔗 Read the latest news at our link in bio. 📷 Yasser Qudih #Gaza #reuters #reutersphotos

Anadolu news agency cameraman Mohammed El Aloul mourns at a hospital in the central Gaza Strip after several of his children and siblings were killed in Israeli strikes, November 5, 2023. U.N. agency leaders saying "enough is enough" demanded a humanitarian ceasefire on Monday, nearly a month into the war, as health authorities in the Hamas-run enclave said the death toll from Israeli strikes now exceeded 10,000.
 
Israel has rebuffed mounting international pressure for a ceasefire, saying hostages taken by Hamas militants during their rampage in southern Israel on Oct. 7 should be released first. 
 
🔗 Read the latest news at our link in bio. 📷 @MohammedSalem85 #Israel #Gaza #journalism #reuters #reutersphotos

Palestinians gather at the site of an Israeli strike on a house in the Jabalia refugee camp in the northern Gaza Strip, November 4, 2023. 

Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas demanded an immediate Israeli ceasefire at a meeting with top U.S. diplomat Antony Blinken as Gaza's health ministry said dozens died in a strike on a refugee camp overnight.

Blinken, who dismissed the idea of a ceasefire by Israel for fear it would benefit Hamas, made an unannounced visit to the occupied West Bank as part of an effort to prevent the Israel-Hamas war from spreading. 

🔗 Read the latest news at our link in bio. 📷 Anas al-Shareef #Gaza #Israel #Jabalia #reuters #reutersphotos

Medics trapped in a clinic tending to the wounded. A father holding a door shut so gunmen can't get in. Two brothers running a freelance rescue operation. Inside the life-and-death struggle in Kibbutz Be'eri during the Hamas assault that set off a major war. 🔗 Read more at our link in bio.
 
#Hamas #Israel #IsraelHamas #War #Gaza #Palestinians #Israelis #News #Reuters #Investigation #Data

Palestinians gather at the site of Israeli strikes on houses in Maghazi, in the central Gaza Strip, November 3, 2023. Israeli forces on Thursday encircled Gaza City - the Gaza Strip's main city - in their assault on Hamas, the military said, but the Palestinian militant group resisted their drive with hit-and-run attacks from underground tunnels.
 
The city in the north of the Gaza Strip has become the focus of attack for Israel, which has vowed to annihilate the Islamist group's command structure in response to Hamas's attack on southern Israel on Oct. 7, and has told civilians to flee to the south. 
 
🔗 Read more at our link in bio. 📷 Mohammed Fayq Abu Mostafa  #Gaza #Israel #reuters #reutersphotos

A boy fixes an Afghan flag on a truck loaded with family belongings outside the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees repatriation centers in Azakhel town in Nowshera, Pakistan, November 1, 2023. 
 
Thousands of people swamped Pakistan's main northwestern border crossing seeking to cross into Afghanistan on Thursday, a day after the government's deadline expired for undocumented foreigners to leave or face expulsion. Pakistani authorities began rounding up undocumented foreigners, most of them Afghans, hours before the deadline. More than a million Afghans would have to leave or face arrest and forcible expulsion as a result of the ultimatum delivered by the Pakistan government a month ago. 
 
🔗 Read more at our link in bio. 📷 @Fayazazi #Afghanistan #Pakistan #conflict #reuters #reutersphotos

Israeli soldiers from the IDF's Home Front Command recover an Israeli flag as they search damaged cars for human remains and other evidence on a field near Netivot in southern Israel, November 1, 2023. 
 
Israeli forces killed another Hamas commander on Wednesday in their second strike on Gaza's largest refugee camp in two days, the military said, as the first group of civilian evacuees from the besieged enclave crossed into Egypt.
 
Pressing their offensive against Hamas militants, Israel again bombed the densely populated Gaza Strip from land, sea and air in its campaign to destroy the Islamist group after its deadly cross-border rampage into southern Israel on Oct. 7. 
 
🔗 Read more at our link in bio. 📷 Amir Cohen #Israel #reuters #reutersphotos #Hamas
